ingredients: -Sweet Almond Oil and Almond Butter: Nourishes and softens feel of skin.   .-Organic Shea Butter: Nourishes, moisturizes, and visibly softens skin.  ..Aqua/Water, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Cete Aryl Alcohol, Olus Oil/Vegetable Oil, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, C10-18 Triglycerides, Cetyl Palmitate, Hydrogenated Vegetable Oil, Cetearyl Glucoside, Carbomer, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Gluconate, Xanthan Gum, Tocopherol, Sodium Hydroxide, Parfum/Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Coumarin, Ci 77492/Iron Oxides.

reviews.review_text: I've always loved L'Occitane's Amande scent. Growing up, my mother used the body wash, lotions, and oil; I loved how the scent would trail after her, intertwining with her Chanel No. 5. I was permitted to use her L'Occitane products on special occasions, which I coveted every milisecond of. They felt so luxurious; so hydrating that my skin would gleam after application, and the scent was unbelievably enchanting, deliciously fragrant. The aroma made me feel so elegant, so put together.     I'm pleased to learn that these products are exactly the same as I remember, and now that I am an adult with the budget for it, I will be treating myself to more of these Amande products. I may not actually be elegant and luxurious, but you would certainly think so if you smelled me.
